meanings.definition: A material, such as straw or reeds, used to cover a roof.
meanings.sent1: The old cottage had thick thatches on its roof.
meanings.sent2: The farmer gathered fresh thatches to repair the roof.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous wind played with the thatches on the roof, making them dance.
meanings.sent4: The thatches on the roof swayed gently in the breeze like a golden sea.
meanings.sent5: The thatches on the roof rustled softly in the quiet night.

meanings.definition: To cover a roof with thatch.
meanings.sent1: The villagers thatch their houses to keep them cool in summer.
meanings.sent2: The thatcher expertly thatches the roof of the barn.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to thatch their playhouse with imaginary straw.
meanings.sent4: She carefully thatches the roof, ensuring it is tightly packed.
meanings.sent5: The thatch work on the roof was so neat, it looked like a golden blanket.
